Time passes . . .

The early hours of the night had moved on. The moon went=
 from
appearing on the east, rising up and over the intrepid Maximals and
P=
redacons and once again beginning to settle back down into the west.

In th=
e mean time TUSCON has been able to hand out his reserve supply,
sacrificin=
g his energy reserves so that his Maximals are able to gain
back a little o=
f their strength. That is all except RODIMUS. Being
that RODIMUS rode on TU=
SCON's back and really had not expended much in
the way of energon, plus he=
 was some distance away from the rest. He
felt that for him to return and r=
etrace his route would not be the
most cost effective and so declined.

Ins=
tead RODIMUS and CYCLONUS continued their goal of following the
route that =
the Dinosaurs had taken to reach this location, their road
actually surpris=
ingly smooth, owing to the fact that you had a large
number of reptiles run=
ning over any foliage and obstacles that may
have once stood in the way. It=
 would be some time before trees and
brush would begin to reclaim the area =
that was lost.


*        *        *        *        *        *        *   =
     *

At the same time NIGHTSHIFT, STRAIGHT SHOT, WASPINATOR, SCOURGE and=

ELITA finish their sweep of the dinosaurs and have a pretty well
definite =
mapping perimeter of things. The dinosaurs covered at least
the size of a U=
.S. state, although that was because they had ranged
out so much. In actual=
ity they covered several miles from end to end.

By the time they have fini=
shed their search FRACTYL's chemical formula
had been used to literally eva=
porate the dinosaurs, leaving the air
still smelling putrid, but no longer =
was there any sign of the
reptiles left - only fallen and crushed trees, sh=
rubs and other
assorted things.

STRAIGHT SHOT was at last able to zero in =
on the signal that she had
been picking up, it had taken her the entire tim=
e since the signal had
been moving, it took her some time to actually reali=
ze that. Each time
she would think she had it, it would seem to be in a dif=
ferent
location.

Finally, now behind a clump of trees she thinks she has i=
t, she could
see the dark shape of someone or something watching her with c=
rimson
optics. The shape even looks a little familiar to her, but it is
dif=
ficult to make out in the darkness.

=93Wasspintor don=92t like dark shadow=
 bot.=94 His wings began to buzz
angrily as his stinger missiles began to g=
low with power. SCOURGE and
his sweeps fanned out as they prepared for an a=
ttack run.

=93Wait.=94 SCOURGE said, =93That thing seems familiar.=94

The=
re was a chuckle from the darkness as a dark figure stepped out
into view. =
He was black and muted silver, his armor solid and
powerfully built. He was=
 immediately recognizable as he moved into a
clearing. Everything was the s=
ame . . . missile launchers on his
forearms, a large rifle in his, the swag=
ger in his step and a
firebrand emblazoned on his chest =96 although this o=
ne was silver and
black instead of the familiar red and yellow.

=93Shadow =
bot is Rodimus?=94 WASPINATOR said as he almost dropped STRAIGHT
SHOT again=
 but not quite.

=93No!=94 SCOURGE said, =93He is Dark Rodimus . . . but ho=
w?=94

The dark figure looked over at SCOURGE and the rest and chuckled as =
he
manipulated something on his arm.


*        *        *        *        =
*        *        *        *


Meanwhile TUSCON waits for his promised back=
 up . . .

. . .  and waits . . .

                             . . . and w=
aits . . .

Finally there is a call from LEO PRIME to TUSCON, "Tuscon, have=
 you
heard anything from the Fuzors? They have missed their last check in."=


In the distance a single dark shape moved toward TUSCON's position,
its I=
FF signature indicating that it was one of the Fuzors - NOCTORRO!

The Fuzo=
r, even from this distance, did not look to be in good shape
at all. His fl=
ight was erratic and jerky as he approached.

(TAG)

Preston
